intro: Pleioluma wandae, commonly known as the Wandae's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and absorbing moisture from the air. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Due to its limited habitat and threats from deforestation, Pleioluma wandae is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
